This place is little and can get packed very quickly even on a week day and at times when you didn't even know anyone could eat!
We tried the crab cake entree and the steamed shellfish combination. Both were good though not amazingly good that I would rave about it. The food was very (very!) garlic-y (in a "don't-open-your-mouth-you-might-kill-someone" way!) and the service was dismissive at best. Overall, we found it was really overpriced for the experience.
Don't worry, we'll try other seafood places while here!
author: Jehanne A.

description:
I ordered a dozen oysters and 6 were brought out. There were three different kinds and all were great quality. I was just a little disappointed because I hate asking for someone to correct a mistake (I wanted a dozen!). Next had the Caesar salad which had way too much dressing and given that it is a seafood spot that prides itself on freshness and quality I would have liked to have seen anchovies in the salad. Next we had the crab cakes which had a good flavor but not enough texture for a crab cake. A crab cake should have a crispy outer layer and then the meat should not be mushy on the inside, these were mainly mushy. Last I had the clam chowder and it was great and definitely hit the spot that day. 
As far as drinks go, I wanted to order a Bloody Mary but they informed me that sake is used instead of vodka. I was no longer interested so a staff member brought out a sample, I swear it tasted just like cocktail sauce...
Cute spot but overpriced and mediocre in my opinion.
author: Alixandre S.

description: This place has been here forever. The fresh fish is absolutely fabulous. Its a staple for the neighborhood, and I am glad it has not turned into another nail salon or Greek Pita place. (WTF Castro?) We went on a Saturday and only waited about 10 minutes for lunch . Share the giant Cioppino bowl and it was the "small". Best shellfish ever, giant mussels, full of fresh cod. Delicious base. Highly recommended. And don't give restaurants a bad review because you had to wait. That's your problem. Bring a jacket, its windy in the Castro.
author: Lola S.

description: Scallops for an appetizer, oysters sampler, Caesar salad with crab meat and the Crab burger were all excellent. Staff was very nice.
author: James O.

description:
Simple and Sweet

What can i say? This is probably one of the best places i've eaten raw oysters and seafood at! Its super fresh and not extremely briny. I went with my friends on off hours and this place was still packed! . We ordered the clam chowder, half anchor special and crab cakes and everything was to die for as its all fresh and done in house! One great thing about the chowder is you get those buttery oyster crackers which makes it phenomenal!

Its a small shop but the staff there takes care of you like family. They are extremely tentative and the decor really fits the name of the restaurant. Considering it is San Fransisco we thought everything would be extremely expensive but the prices are exceptionally reasonable for the amount you get. our bill came out to roughly 15 a person which is exceptional!  

Cant wait to come back next time to try the cioppino!
author: Tim L.

description: Not bad at all, even tho it's kind of pricey it still worth it to me. Once you see the bowl of the large ciopinno you'll be amazed lol I mean it's pretty huge I took my time on that. It's not too rich not too soupy watery it's just right to me... with a fresh grounded  black pepper and jalapeño sauce yupppp I'm going in.. the waiting wasn't that bad that day was only 15 mins wait.. the place is so small and it's just for people to eat get gone and be about their life... service was great the lady was so nice to me no attitude:) will definitely come back
author: Alexandria K.

description: this place was not overrated. i do wish there was more selections for oysters lol but super fresh! must get the cioppino!! it was so freaken good. make sure u write your name on the board before going in (even of the place is empty) or esle they will not sit u! lol
author: Edna L.

description:
Nothing beats some seafood on a rainy night. I've had this location bookmarked for the longest time and finally had the chance to give it a try. Dropped by and was able to find parking less than a block away on the streets and maneuvered quickly through the pouring rain to sign up on the wait list. The restaurant is literally 5 tables big and only has one bar length table to hold 6-8 people. I'd say 25 people max in the restaurant so the wait was pretty long. The host told us it was going to be one hour + of a wait.... and he was RIGHT. We tried to find shelter from the rain close by at Philz Coffee while there was a bench stationed outside the restaurant but it was packed and wet from the rain. 

After a loooong wait, we were finally seated and on our way to dive in on the food. 
We ordered:

Small Clam chowder - very flavorful and delicious, perfect sizing appetizer for one person 

Oyster shooter - bigger than most places, very flavorful sauce with a big oyster piece at the bottom of it... Celery included to kill the strong taste in your mouth afterwards

Mussels in white wine sauce- this has got to be the hugest mussels I've eaten... It was literally so meaty and served in a huge dish plate. I think it's a great proportion to split it between two people. The sauce was filled with herbs and garlic pieces... I just felt like drinking the broth at one point. 5 star dish!!!


Jumbo prawn pasta - This was our carbs of the dinner supported once again HUGE prawns. Delicious flavoring for the pasta and once again great proportion to split! 

Despite the long long wait in a tiny local restaurant I think the food here is AMAZING and along with great professional customer service... It just has to be a 5 star location. 

PS: The day we went, waiting line board said cash only but I believe do accept cards usually...
author: Auden W.

description:
A rainy, stormy Saturday night led us here. We signed ourselves in on the whiteboard where you put your name, party size, and arrival time. I like how they ask you for your arrival time so you actually know how long you've been waiting. We were told the wait would possibly be over an hour, but that didn't stop us! I'm always willing to wait for my first time at any restaurant if it's supposed to be really good. There's plenty of shops around the area to explore while waiting for your party to be called so the wait doesn't seem too long! 

The restaurant is small - it only fits 25 people at most. Most of the parties before and after us were parties of two. I think they could've seated more people at a time if they had split their square tables into two smaller tables. Just throwing out a suggestion to help accommodate more customers at once, y'know? 

We waited a little over an hour to get seated at the bar. We ordered a cup of clam chowder, a oyster shooter for him, green lip mussels, and some sort of shrimp pasta that was not on the menu (I saw pictures on yelp and asked for it!) The clam chowder was creamy and was just the perfect size for sharing.. I really liked the little potato bits in the soup. The oyster shooter.. I didn't try because I'm not too big of a fan. He said it had lots of flavor. His eye was literally twitching every gulp he took! The green lip mussels were HUUUUUUUUGE. They were the biggest mussels I have ever eaten in my life! The flavor of the broth was delicious. The shrimp pasta was yummy too. The shrimp were HUGE too, wowza. We didn't think we were gonna get full off of anything before we got any of our dishes, but what we ordered was more than enough. The portion sizes were definitely worth the price! 

Staff constantly checked up on us which was great. Offered to put our broths in smaller bowls just in case we wanted to keep them to dip our bread in. Thanks for asking! 

Satisfied my mussels craving... it's been a while since I've had mussels in a different broth/sauce. We always have Cajun... finally somethin' different for once *eye roll* 

I do recommend trying this place if you're looking for great customer service and fresh seafood. Also, EXPECT the long wait. Places like this always have a long wait.
author: Sydney C.

description:
So simple, but so good.

I had been anticipating a meal at Anchor Oyster Bar all weekend in my most recent trip to SF, mostly because I had really wanted some good fresh shellfish in a simple low-key environment. I was afraid that I would hype it up too much in my head, but thankfully, I was not let down at all.

My friends and I managed to avoid long lines by going at around 4pm on a Monday, snagging a few seats at the bar. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful with their recommendations, and explained the specials quite nicely. We went with the half-order of the Anchor special: 6 oysters, 2 prawns, and steamed clams, as well as the greenlip mussels. The oysters were really tasty, and they gave us a variety of the Island Creek oysters that they "import." The prawns were enormous and perfect with a little bit of lemon and cocktail sauce. Hoo-wee. However, the clams were really what blew me away. The steamed clams were tender and flavorful, and that broth! THAT BROTH. It was rich, savory, and just something I could drink and sop up with bread over and over. It had a bit of a sour profile, and the seafood flavors really enhanced everything. 

As for the greenlip mussels, the broth that they came was just as delicious, with an amped up spiciness and acidity, as there was some tomato strewn throughout. The mussels themselves were also HUGE. I had never had these New Zealand mussels before, and they were really nice and tender. The shells were pretty aesthetically pleasing too, although we didn't really spend too much time with the shells, haha. Easily a must-order if you like a spicier broth and the meatiness of mussels.

As mentioned before, the staff was very friendly and chatty, in addition to being very efficient and helpful. While it's reasonably priced for seafood, it's definitely pricey if you're eating solo, so bring a date or a few friends so you can share a bunch of things. Make sure to come on an off-peak time to avoid lines. Also, note that they open late in the afternoon on Sundays, so sadly, there's no hope of a Sunday oyster brunch.

The menu may not be as diverse as that of Swan Oyster Depot, but it is straightforward, and the flavors are immense and delicious. Anchor will likely be one of my first return stops on my future trips to SF. I still have yet to try their famous cioppino, so that'll have to be a priority next time.
author: Eric J.

description:
Is anything worth a 2 hour wait?? Hard to say for sure but the cioppino at Anchor Oyster Bar is the best I've had. I see why people wait and wait for a chance to be seated at the bar or at a table to sample the oh so good San Francisco creation. Anchor is located on very busy Castro Street next to the original location of Harvey Milk HQ/camera shop. Read the plaques.

We arrived around 8pm. There was a good amount of people waiting already. We put our name on the board and one of the staff members said it would be about 45min to an hour wait. I wish that was the case. We didn't get seated until around 10pm. They are supposed to close at 10pm but they assured everyone waiting that they go through the whole list. They want to make sure people that have been waiting get to eat. It was a cool city night and around 9pm one of the staff came outside to give everyone cups of steaming hot clam chowder. It was really good clam chowder and it hit the spot. That was nice on their part because the restaurant space is small and people that are waiting can be out in the cold for a long time.

We were seated at the bar. The bar seats about 8 people and there are a handful of tables around it. We started off with the half order of the Anchor Special: 6 oysters, 4 steamed clams and 2 chilled prawns ($22.95). It was delicious. The oysters were tasty, they gave us many more clams than we expected as it had been served in this garlicky goodness of a broth that made for good buttered bread dipping. The chilled prawns were SO DAMN GOOD. The prawns were so sweet and and tasty. Tasted like the ocean. Pure goodness. Gimme 6 of those next time. The Anchor Special was great with the bread that was served as a starter. Really good and thick cut. 

Next up was the cioppino. The oh so glorious cioppino we got was the full order. It is huge. Feeds 3 easily but since we waited so long and were so hungry, we figure why not go all in? So we did. Priced at $59.95 so its not cheap but it is well worth it. You get everything and more in this massive stew of the ocean's greatest hits. You get white fish, clams, mussels, crab, prawns, baby clams, shrimp and that broth... You just wanna swim in it. Like a hot spring but better. Ha! It really was good. The cioppino was excellent. You have to get it. I warn you... It is HUGE and the servers will even show you the bowl sizes to illustrate just how big. Excellent for garlic bread dipping. It came with some REALLY good, thick garlic bread. So good. You might be offered a bib to wear. It can get awesomely messy.

Service was excellent. The staff had a great attitude as I'm sure it was a long day for them but  true to their word, they accommodated everyone on the list. They do periodically come outside to see any updates or drop outs on the sign in list. So they definitely stay on top of things. They even gave us a glass of a red that one of the staff brought as they were having a Hungarian dinner after hours prepared by the chef who is of Hungarian descent. That was nice of them. I look forward to returning and having more of that cioppino, more shellfish and some of that clam chowder. We'll be sure to get there earlier next time. Way earlier. Street parking available if the gods are smiling on you.
author: Chuck D.

description: Probably a 4.5. Chowder and garlic bread are both great. The amount of crab that you get on a caesar salad is insane. Couldn't finish. Cioppino is joke size. Broth is a little spicier than you normally see.
author: J A.

description: Saw this place on yelp and decided to give it a try! I came here on a Monday night without a reservation and there was a 10-15 min wait. The place is super small but it's really cute and gives off a cozy vibe. We ordered the small half anchor combination (crab meat,shrimp,prawns) small cioppino(VERY LARGE with prawns,crab legs,clams,mussels,fish(?) &garlic bread), seared scallops(not on menu, but ask!) and the shellfish combination(super zesty clams,mussels and prawns). It was a lot of food for two people but we managed to finish it all. I recommend place for parties of two or four but no more than that! The area around it is super cute to walk around at night as well.
author: Lori D.

description: Cioppinno is one of the best, as one of my favorite dishes of which I've had made from scratch, home made.  Great local ambiance and atmosphere.  Delicious oysters.
author: Mike Z.

description: Loved the food, been going here for years, but I just got off the phone with a very rude staff member that responded to an innocent question about reservations for special occasions very condescendingly and passive-aggressively. The food is already expensive, the wait already an eternity, if I'm going to get attitude on top of that for no reason then this place is no longer worth the headache. So sad to be saying goodbye to this place.
author: Kristen G.

description:
I thought the steamed mussels and clams at Hog Island was bomb. This is next level amazing. Expect a wait about 30-45 minutes so write your name on the board and go grab a drink around the Castro. 

Cioppino: wow! 5/5. Got the smaller size with another dish and it was wayyyy too much food for two people. Loved the tomato sauce. 

Steamed shellfish combo: also 5/5! Huge dish, enough for at least 2-3 people. A vodka sauce I think? I'd get it again but if I were to pick one I'd go for the cioppino

I'd come back, just don't bring a huge party with you
author: Flang N.

description: Omg! Tiny, adorable and the food is amazing! Stop in here during the week and there won't be a wait. Do t miss this gem!
author: Lindsay W.

description:
LOVE. JUST LOVE.

I'm old, okay? Gone are the days I'll happily wait in line for food (IN THE COLD, MIND YOU), but for this place I make an exception. The ambience is nothing to write home about, but the seafood here is INCREDIBLE.

Our first time here we had a starter of clams and we knew we were in for a treat. They were perfectly done, with a generous portion in a delicious herbed wine garlic sauce. Next, we ordered the cioppino- a large (which scared the waiter) but we let him know we'd handle it ;].

The cioppino was just PERFECTION. The large was huge - definitely big enough for 3-4 but since the dude and I don't really eat bread, it was the perfect amount. All the seafood was perfectly cooked, and the prawns were the size of my hand! The soup was also just out of this world too, I wish we had saved it for reuse at home. It was hot, garlicky and had just enough heat to give it great depth. We also had a nibble of the infamous garlic bread and immediately pushed it away- only because it was way too good to stop eating. It was soft inside and crispy on top, layered with tons of yummy parmesan and garlic. People ordered extra sides of JUST the bread, and I can see why. All the food we had that day was literally lick-your-plate good food.

We sat at the bar which we were originally bummed about, but the bartender was so funny and nice that he made it a real joy. This really is the best cioppino I've had in my life- and well worth the wait! A quintessential sample of food the bay area is famous for.

Totally perfect as a casual date spot :)
author: Jackie C.

description:
The CIOPPINO. blew. me away.  It's THE BEST.  And I've had cioppino at 3 different places in the Bay Area now.  The small was so hot and brimming full of seafood, I couldn't even finish it.  And as small as I am, I do not waste food.  It's unfortunate, mussels were the casualty I left behind.  There was a true assortment of seafood:  fish (possibly sea bass - awesome texture), clams, Dungeness crab, 2 HUGE shrimp, and two types of mussels.  Along with my cioppino, I had a glass of Russian River Chardonnay and an assortment of 3 different oysters.  Altogether, my bill for 1 came to $75.  

The place is cozy but truly a gem on Castro.  Service was impeccable too.
author: Patricia N.

description:
Love how hidden this joint was in downtown San Francisco. I took my brother and his fiancé to Anchor Oyster Bar and we had a blast. The oysters were fresh, the white wine was flowing and the service was fantastic.

If you're an architecture buff, this is definitely a place to go check out. The interior of the restaurant was rustically gorgeous.
author: Will M.

description: Really good crab cakes and excellent cioppino. The broth was heartier than I expected and it was such a fun dish to share! Generously portioned and filling, the mussels were the standout for me. Loved sopping up the delicious broth with garlic bread. Will be back to try their specials and oysters.
author: Jordan Q.

description:
This is a great oyster bar and they have good food and the menu is great. I feel that food is fresh and it's pretty decent dining spot. 

I must however note that the house wine made me and my wife sick one time, definitely not a great quality.

It's also a place that does not sit you and your party even if you arrived earlier than everyone and are really hungry.

There is a weird sign in sheet outside where you enter your name and amount of people in your party and you wait outside, sometimes there are 10-15 people camped outside in a wind or under a very bright sun. They also play favorites, right in front of us after waiting for 20 minutes they let a couple with a kid in without the wait based on some personal criteria.

Service sucks as they ignore you for a long period of time before serving you, it's very impolite and offensive service.

Price is high, expect to pay at least $100 per person for a decent sized meal, I would say stay away for the most part - it's not worth the hype.
author: Erast B.

description:
It's no wonder why there's always a longass line.
To avoid it, come during off hours. I happened to be walking by on a Saturday at 3 PM and we were seated right away. So glad I was just randomly in the Castro that day at that time.

CIOPINNO - best I've had in the city so far. It's the perfect flavor (balance of tomato and seafood flavor) and texture (not too thick or thin). And man, does it come with a shitton of seafood. Definitely good to share between multiple people and a good bang for your buck.

CRABCAKES - I'm pretty sure these are the best crabcakes I've had to date as well. They give you ACTUAL crab and don't cheapen it up with batter.

CLAM CHOWDER - AAAAAAND yup, you guessed it.. solid as well. One of the top clam chowders I've had, too.

Come here if you want amazing seafood done right. Hopefully you won't have to wait too long!
author: Emily C.

description: Anchor Oyster Bar is NOW an SF institution at over 40 years old which is saying something for a World Class Food City like San Francisco. As a 3rd Gen Native SFer myself who grew up on Cioppino from North Beach and other Sicilian?Italian Seafood dishes over last 50 years? They do an amazing Job. There are some seating and small establishment issues which make it stifling for me at times. As I like Room to eat and move. But in SF ANY Real Estate is at a Premium.. ha even seating space I guess.  But again they keep it simple, keep it good and consistent and you know what to expect. The menu has added some refreshing new specials as of late and I personally have never had a bad experience there, outside of me being a Big Clumsy guy and almost knocking over the patrons glass of wine and Bowl of Cioppino sitting next to me at the Bar.  ;)
author: Adam S.

description: Really rustic, quality meal.  Came on a busy Saturday night, put our name on there list and waited for over an hour.  The heater and bench's outside were a nice touch.  Ordered the chippino, oysters on a half shell, oyster shooters, wild prawns, clam chowder, and Caesar salad.  If I would have any criticism, it would be that the prawns were slightly over cooked and in my mind I was thinking Santa Barbara's spot prawn and what came out what looked like a Jumbo shrimp that you'd find on the end of a martini glass.  I wouldn't say that anything stood out in particular but everything was well done, tasty and well prepared.  The decor was fitting and minimalist.  Service was thoughtful and their timing was good.
author: Matt B.

description: We had to wait quite a while on a Sunday night late. There was a reason. It was because it was so very good. Two of us sat at the counter (only seats available) and shared a gigantic bouillabaisse. It was very filling. Great value - a ton of fish. Exceptional staff. We loved it. PS while we waited the owner brought out complimentary clam chowder to everyone and thanked us for waiting. All well done.
author: Jow H.

description: Clam Chowdah, oysters, garlic bread, shrimp & crab cocktail. Amazing. Sit at the bar if you can. Super great service and spot on sea food. Enjoy!
author: Barbie B.

description:
Gem in the Castro! I've been going to this place for over 10 years. The food is consistently good. Its a small place. Not a good place for big groups. The kitchen is small and clean. The service is excellent. The staff is friendly. I highly recommend the Cioppino. This is a good dish to share if you're on a date. Also order the garlic bread. It gets pack in the weekend so get there early. 


T would gable up the cioppino.
author: Victor Y.

description: Okay, so I get it, really this is only a place you go for oysters. After coming back from Sydney and having the most fabulous oysters I knew there was only one place that could match it.... Anchor... Don't go for anything exotic here just stick to what they are good at, raw oysters, the combination Ceasar salad and the cioppino. Ignore the fish and anything else, stick to the mollusks
author: R J.

description:
First things first - get to Anchor Oyster Bar early (or at least be prepared to wait)! It's a small and cute restaurant but much like many oyster bars I've been to, seating is limited and comes on a first come, first serve basis. At the very least, they're nice enough to call your name a few times and try to accommodate if you don't hear your name.  

Now, let's say you finally get into the restaurant. It's bustling; it's busy with waiters all around. The restroom requires you to go past the kitchen so you get to see a bit of the workshop and that's small too!  

Finally seated - what do you see? You get a two-page spread menu filled with seafood goodies. Now, it could have been my hungry stomach from the wait or the actual food itself but everything we had was very solid. We had the following interesting delicacies: 

Dungeness crab: Coming in 1/2 and full orders, the full order for two was more than enough. Lots of crab pieces (and yes, you'll have to dig in with your hands...wish they gave towel wipes). The crab was cooked well; the garlic sauce delicious (wipe that bread in there!) and all the sauces/condiments you need were at your side. 
Garlic bread: All the Yelpers recommend it and yea...you do get a complimentary loaf of bread but the garlic bread is just buttery, garlic goodness that fits perfectly with the rest of the seafood. Well worth it (also comes in 1/2 and full varieties - the 1/2 was more than enough for a party of 2)
Clam chowder: Only got a cup but it was solid - nothing more, nothing less (and a cup came with the crab entree!)  

Pricing-wise, for two, it ended up being around $60ish which wasn't too shabby.  So if you don't mind the wait, the small premises and the busy hustle - seafood lovers are in for a treat.
author: John W.

description: We came here around 5 on a Saturday, there was already a line when we arrived. Service is friendly and fast. The menu is very simple, seafood is super fresh. We will definitely come back again!
author: Angela W.

description: OMFG. just go here. amazing food. the cioppinno was one of the best i've had in quite some time. huge portion and tasted great.
author: Justin L.

description: Excellent service and extraordinary food. I followed the advice to show up when they open and did not have to wait for a seat.
author: Andrew C.

description: Wonderful Cioppino! You might be in for a bit of a wait, and don't wander once you've signed up, but it's well worth it.
author: Karla D.

description: The cioppino is amazing as is the linguini and clams. The only drawback is the wait, but well worth it.
author: Manuel G.

description: The place is comfy and cozy, can feel a bit crowded. The small size is huge enough even for two and the larger size will feed 3 hungry people.
author: Micah S.

description:
It was fantastic.... 
Small but with a fantastic ambiance.....
All seafood is fresh and the taste comes across as very fresh.... 

Our table ordered the trout special, which was cooked to perfection, prawns plate - fabulous.... And an order of the crab cake entree..... Oh yeah, we also had oysters and claims for an appetizer.......

We did not order any liquor and our total bill came out to about $150 for the 3 of us......
author: Houman E.

description:
The 1000th review! =)

Not only is the food obviously awesome here - the staff and how they treat their customers speak volumes to the kind of establishment this is.

Being a popular place with limited seating - you can most likely expect a wait. I went this past Wed around 7 - took about 35-40 minutes to get a table. While waiting, a staff came outside to pass out samplers of their clam chowder and thank us all for waiting - wow who does that anymore?! 

The clam chowder was delicious - not too thick/heavy but full of flavor.
I got both the steamed shellfish combo ($29) and the small cioppino ($37). If you're a party of 2 - probably shouldn't get both because the portion size will shock you - trust me - my jaw dropped as they placed the food on my table. I've never been to a seafood joint where they're that generous with their portions - please never change :)

The steamed shellfish combo itself would have probably been enough for 2 with some additional apps. The small cioppino was slightly smaller but still enough for 2. Out of the both - my favorite was the steamed shellfish - one of the most amazing lemon, garlic, butter, herb broths I've had in a seafood dish. The mussels, clams, jumbo shrimp were all fresh, cooked perfectly, and seeped in that wonderful sauce. 

The cioppino was delicious as well - light and thin tomato broth but packed full of seafood and flavor. I liked this dish but just thought the steamed shellfish packed more of a punch on the sauce - can't go wrong with butter and garlic. 

Speaking of garlic - order the garlic bread basket! Amazing, toasted, crisp bread with garlic, butter, and cheese shavings. You'll want this to dip into the shellfish sauce.
author: Brenda L.

description:
Recommended by my coworker, our team made a trip out to the Castro for an early lunch.  Even before the restaurant opened, there was a list of names waiting to get in already.  The place is small, so definitely go early.

We went with the specials menu, and I had the Open faced sandwich.  At $16.95 it's a bit pricey for lunch, but it was so filling and delicious.  Heaping amounts of crab/shrimp covered with cheese on a crunchy piece of toast, it was decadent.

The service was a bit lacking, and it took half an hour for the food to come out.  So come here if you have plenty of time and don't need to hurry back to the office.
author: Karen L.

description: Worth waiting for. Delicious food, despite having to queue. Just ride it out!! The oysters were delicious, and the wines are decent priced for San Francisco.
author: Michael O.

description: An excellent place. Excellent service, fast and quality. Prices are slightly high, but it's worth it. Wonderful selection of wines. Delicious and high-quality food. Highly recommend.
author: Vanessa H.

description: I've lived in San Francisco for 37 years and Anchor Oyster Bar is my FAVORITE restaurant. Plan to wait on the comfy bench outside and enjoy the sights of Castro Street. The seafood is so fresh and delicious. The staff is always friendly and relaxed. Perfect date night. Thank you Anchor Oyster Bar!
author: M.E. T.

description: Great place for all sorts of seafood. Each time I travel to San Francisco we come here and enjoy the food, service, atmosphere and people. Amazing spot in Castor!
author: Torsten H.

description:
I love and hate this place.  I love their cioppino... it is on my top five all-time meals in life.  The perfect blend of herbs, tomatoes, seafood (big chunks of shrimp, fish, clams, etc.) and the amazing garlic toast that accompanies everything.

And that's why I hate this place... I don't live in San Francisco and there is no place that comes remotely close to making a cioppino this good.  They've ruined cioppinos everywhere else for me... Sigh.
author: Scott K.

description:
AMAZING AMAZING FOOD. Must try for everyone who loves fresh seafood!

Got 1/2 anchor special: fresh oysters, steamed clams and shrimp. The oysters were super fresh and delicious but nothing TOO special compared to other places like Hog Island, same goes for shrimp. The steamed clams though were ON POINT. The broth it came with was super flavorful and the clams tasted very fresh and were cooked perfectly.

The **CIOPPINO****: AMAZING. MUST ORDER. We got the small and it was huge. Tomato base broth flavored with tons of herbs and spices. Explosion of flavor in your mouth - absolutely delicious and incredible! Loads of fresh seafood in it too (mussels, shrimp, crab). 

Garlic Bread was soooo good too! Especially paired with the cioppino. 

The service was so great too! They were very attentive and my bf and I were in a rush so our waiter rushed our order for us and delivered our food super fast. He was very considerate! 

The prices do run a bit high; we paid about $90 for the meal but we were so full and the seafood was so fresh. The wait is also definitely worth it! This is my new go to spot for delicious seafood; will DEFINITELY be back!!
author: Cynthia H.

description: Great food, great service, great atmosphere!!!!!!  My husband and I ordered the Crab Cake and Wild Prawns platters.  Exquisite!
author: La Rae B.

description: The experience was almost 6/5 stars but then they spilled a totally full beer and didn't offer to refill it or take it off the bill. We didn't ask because the experience was great and we were happy, but should have been a reflex.
author: Joey A.

description: Looks like I found a pearl of a place for great service great food and oysters are the best in this SF neighborhood
author: Ric C.

description:
Sat at the bar on a Monday evening enjoyed good company with local oyster lovers with wonderful service.
It's a wait and sometimes I hear it's an extremely long one but Worth It.
Had Green Lip Mussels, pasta of the day with clams, Scallops added.
It was perfection. With a bottle of bubbles.
Draft beers are well priced and wine list is good. Pairs well with the amazing food.
Highly recommend.
author: Heather D.

description: The customer service is great however I would like to be honest about the cioppino. First of all several reviews claim that the large portion is enough for 4-5 adults which is false. My husband and I were able to complete the whole bowl with nothing left but extra broth. The broth was good but lacked appropriate flavoring. Regarding the contents of the soup, I was taken back by the fact that the large portion only had TWO large shrimp for $60!! Not only that, our soup did not have any scallops and most cioppino dishes I have had from other restaurants have definitely had scallops. It comes with garlic bread which was just ok. We ordered an extra order of bread however it had a bitter taste and it was baked too hard. Forgot to mention that the clam chowder here was also very lack luster. I was hoping for a better experience with the food  based on the other over the top reviews.
author: Dani J.

description: Where do I begin,  came here Valentine's Day to try something new and was craving seafood and oysters- the aphrodisiac of luv.  The food was a hit and miss though. We ordered a lot of food for two.  But my fave is crab Caesar salad and the main entree special of the day seared scallops.  Jumbo Prawns are delicious. Everything else was ok.  I'm giving this place 4 stars as service polite, and food decent.  Deducting a star because our steam clams had dirt still. I'll just avoid clams next time.
author: Nara S.

description: The best seafood I've had in SF! Totally fell in love with the combo seafood steamers and cioppino! Come here, you won't regret it.
author: Jenny E.

description:
Anchor Oyster Bar is a must try if you're in the area. We waited 30 minutes before it opened, and there was already one couple before us. It's a very small and cozy restaurant, so get acquainted with the people around you. 

Anchor Specials was a good start to try a little bit of everything! A full order is a dozen oysters, with steamed clams, and some chilled prawns. No doubt the oysters were good and fresh. Clam chowder was solid. Sauteed wild prawns was good but not as memorable as the cioppino. The Cioppino was definitely the highlight of the meal. Super hearty and delicious! We had to order extra garlic bread for it too. And it was a generous portion for two that we got to take some home. Best leftover ever!
author: Zha L.

description:
After trying Sotto Mare for their supposedly famous cioppino I have to say I want impressed with it and my hubby and I decided we needed to come back to anchor to satisfy our cioppino craving. Anchor's cioppino is one of my top favorites. They use huge prawns and a good amount of dungeness crab in theirs. I usually don't like mussels but their seafood is so fresh that I even thought the mussels were decent. The anise flavor I mentioned last time was more subtle this time and I actually liked it in the cioppino this time. 

The steamed clams is still one of my favorite broths. I've got to try and recreate that at home. 

On a weds at 6pm we still had a 1 hour wait for 4 ppl, but it's worth the wait.
author: Estella H.

description: All hail seafood masters! Prices are high, but the portions are massive. We gorged ourselves on seafood until we crawled out of the door for dear life. I think I dreamt about shellfish last night.
author: Becca B.

description: This place is amazing. First time here with my fiancé when we visited San Fran the clam soup we got was amazing very flavorful fair price for what it's worth. I would definitely recommend to anyone visiting this area
author: Didem A.

description: Their seafoods are fresh and so well made. I like how their kitchen is so tight and neat in such a small space. The silver and white interior plus the soft lightening are perfectly combined. But this place can be quite loud when it is packed.
author: Zhizhou H.

description:
What a wonderful place.  We were lucky and showed up with only a 10 minute wait.  We ordered the dungeoness crab with a few other things and the food came within about 20 minutes.  I love the fact that you have to walk through the kitchen to get to the bathroom.  This gave me a chance to speak with the chef and get some advice on favorite dishes and best ways to prepare the crab.

As we were eating the server came up and brought champagne glasses and requested that we join in on a toast.  The restaurant was just turned into a landmark by the city after 40 years of being in business.  This was an amazing treat since we were there celebrating an amazing trip with our families to San Francisco and discussing our future.  

What a great time and an awesome little restaurant.  Thank you!
author: Jason G.

description: Such a wonderful meal.  The kindest staff, delicious food, excellent ambiance. The combo Caesar was so abundant with fresh, delicious seafood.  The steamed clams swimming in a mouth watering broth.  Amazing.
author: Fred M.

description: Anchor Oyster Bar definitely doesn't need my review. This place is so damn amazing. I drive from LA to SF solely for this restaurant and nothing else. I won't even stay in SF. They're extremely consistent with their food & customer service. We opt for the shellfish combo doubled which is super! I would recommend this restaurant to anybody!
author: Brandi A.

description: My friend and I were already starving by the time we put our names down and had an hour and a half wait to go because the restaurant is tiny. Like it had a maximum capacity of 30 people tiny. But I can honestly say that it was worth it. Everything we ordered tasted exactly like we needed it to, and we were so satisfied by the time we left. The crab cakes and the garlic bread really stood out. My god were they perfect. I'm coming back here.
author: Pamela C.

description: Great seafood across the board. Been to just about every oyster bar in SF and this is the real deal. Just as good (if not better than) Swan. Got the clam chowder along with the oyster/prawn/mussel special. Everything was perfect. Will be back soon.
author: Zach B.

description: Very good little spot! Absolutely awesome and worth the wait! Everything was quality and fresh! Nice and friendly people. Oysters on a half shell are usually delish. Has a great selection of beer and wine as well. Recommend!
author: Finn F.

description:
Excellent food..had  clam  chowder, oysters,  and crab cakes. Waitress was worthless....the "buss boy" was the star...bread, water,delivered oysters,  brought me my soup when I  asked for it..the waitress was so spaced out she brought my soup with  the other items all at the same time..she left me  there eating  bread and butter for 15 mins before I finally asked  the bus boy for my soup.....
Excellent..if not a bit on  the pricey side....
author: Paul G.

description:
Fresh, sweet crab meat on buttery lettuce. I will be dreaming of this for days.

Cioppino was flavored on point. I added some lemon bc I love all things citrus.

Service was very attentive.
author: Ko K.

description:
So, coming to this place on and off, like it very much. Had a friend stopping by, i was at the bar, table next to us full, they took a chair from the bar so they can pass by easily. My friend was standing next to me, like more than enough space to go in and out off the kitchen and guess what , they basically kicked him out; "Oh you can stand here."


Welll guess what guys, we are not local to this place even if we live in the city, but when castro locals showed up they are able to get food faster, drinks faster, table faster and also thay can be at the end of the bar without no problems!!! 

Seen it with my own eyes!!!!

At the end, I even paid for the meal I was waiting for.  

Terrible experience!!!!
author: Emir L.

description: This spot was amazing. Super cozy- I would imagine there's quite a wait if you go during lunch. We arrived at about 2:00 or so and got a table right away. Their cioppino haunts my dreams- it was absolutely delicious and you get a lot of food! My husband and I could have eaten there every day we were in San Fran- SO GOOD!!!
author: Ashley C.

description: Very nice little spot! this is definitely a gem! the place is small and cozy, can feel a bit crowded but let me tell you it is all worth it. the location is perfect and around some good stores, and as for the food it is just amazing. Definitely will come back soon again!
author: Savanna B.

description:
This was everything I ever dreamt it would be.

I was drawn to this place because my boyfriend recently declared that dipping bread in seafood broth is one of his favorite things ever. The pictures of giant bowls of seafood with a good amount of broth had me sold.

We came here and ordered half an order of garlic bread and a steamed bowl of clams.

I think the food we got could have fed 3-4 people. I meannn... We still ate the majority of the garlic bread and ate all the clams. Two very determined adults can put that stuff away for sure but we were stuffed and ready for a nap after.

The clams came in a giant bowl where you could probably bathe a newborn. But you wouldn't want to do that... because that, folks, would be a waste of broth! The broth was damn sexy. It's a white wine based broth with the right amount of olive oil/butter. It was flavored with lots of garlic, a happy amount of chopped parsley and fresh thyme. The squeeze of lemon lifted up the beautiful flavors of the clams. I just sighed dreamily typing that up.

The garlic bread was amazing. The bread had a nice texture to it so that you could actually lift the piece of bread up without it completely falling apart just because it had been doused in butter. And don't get me wrong, this isn't some diet bread crap. It IS doused in butter. Garlicky butter. And shavings of sharp parmesan. But the nice thing is, they used some really good, crusty bread with a good foundation. It even held up to being dipped in the clam broth.

Service was a little slow in the beginning but it picked up eventually and all went well. They were super friendly and clearly take pride in their food -- as they should!
author: Felisa D.

description: I have been here before and had great meals, but Monday I went there and had their green mussels  in some wine sauce with garlic and tomatoes with  many fresh herbs, absolutely delish.. with a salad and drink about 30.00 . If you are a green lip mussel eater its a must.
author: David H.

description: Freakin' tasty. Cutest little restaurant right in the heart of the Castro, always busy and bustling which speaks to how popular and delicious it is. The garlic butter Dungeness crab is absolutely the thing to order. Don't miss this place!
author: Paris W.

description:
Mussels crabias oystmigos!

Full resto, signed the waitlist.
Closing time came & went.
Oystbro erased the waitlist &
scrawled over it "CLOSED".
So much for that; I walk away.
Oystbro hollers up the block
that I can still go in & eat.

Mix Seaf Cocktail: mmm
Clam Chowd: use straw not spoon
Peter Point Oystys: salty
Blue Point Oystys: no salt(!)
Iced Tea: #basic but #mandatory

$90 later, #dinneraccomplished.
4th star bc excelente servicio
author: Dan B.

description: This place is awesome! Their Cioppino's the best in town. Everything inside the cioppino is fresh and yumm. I love their parmesan garlic bread that they give with the cioppino. Must go place in San Francisco!
author: Ellen K.

description: I absolutely love seafood so The Anchor Oyster Bar is definitely the place for me. I usually I get started with a cup of clam chowder; indeed, I can't recall eating at The Anchor Oyster Bar and not having this soup. It's full of flavor and seasoned so well that it leaves you craving for more -- the only addictive soup I have ever had. Other great finds here are the oysters on a half shelf, which are always fresh and those oh so yummy crab cakes. It's easy to do crab cakes bad, but at this place, they are just different from the classic crab cakes most of restaurants have on their menu. The Anchor Oyster Bar is a bit pricey but you won't regret paying for this quality of food. I have been trying to try the entire menu and I still have about 40% to go (I won't give up until I taste everything). So far I have liked every dish I have been able to try, however, I really think the Ciopinno and the Dugeness Crab are the finest. The Steam Clams and the Sauteed Wild Prawns are great dishes as well (the clams are a delicious but healthy option). If you like seafood you should give this place a try, I can assure you that you'll be glad you did so.
author: Stella P.

description:
This has been our favorite restaurant in the city hands down for many, many years! We have put this restaurant on such a tall pedestal! We celebrate all our special occassions here as well as bring our out of town guests here. Until the last two time we LOVED this restaurant.
The second to last time we ate here our salmon came to us almost sushi grade-raw. We did not send it back (our mistake) but passed it up as an oversight by the chef. Anyone can make a mistake. 
We took out of town friends there 3 weeks ago and I specifically told the waiter of our previous incident and to make sure the salmon was cooked more so it was flaky. My friends boy-friend and I both ordered it and it came to both of us almost sushi gradef raw. I was quite annoyed that either the waiter did not relay the information or the chef felt that this was how it should be served (even though we've had it before in previous years and it had been served not almost raw). We both sent it back this time and they re-served us smaller pieces of salmon and did not charge us. We appreciate the fact that we were not charged but by the time we got our dinners back the mood and all the raves we had made about the restaurant had been dampened. Our expectations, very disappointed.
Do they have a new chef? WTF?
author: Craig A.

description:
Finally Yelp San Fran came through with a winner. Anchor Bar was a phenomenal experience. The place is super small but they make it work and are really attentive. We came on a Wed around 5:30pm, wrote our name on the board and waited for about 15 mins before our name was called. I got the small Ciopinno which is definitely enough for two people and a 1/2 order of garlic bread. My coworker got the crabcake dinner. Well for a first time Ciopinno eater who did extensive research on who had the best, I settled on Anchor Bar being my "first" Ciopinno experience and I am so glad that I did.

The Ciopinno was loaded with flavor and seafood. All of the seafood was cooked to perfection, not one thing was overcooked and that is extremely important. I could bathe in the broth and consume mounds of garlic bread to dip it in. This service was great. At no point did I feel rushed to finish my meal. They take pride in making their dishes as they make them to order and take their time which results in a memorable and amazing dining experience.

It's small and tight in there but it's like going to visit a friend for a good meal and a good time, you're having such a enjoyable experience the size is the last thing your thinking about. 

It's definitely worth a visit.
author: Georgianna J.

description:
This place is amazing. We go there three times a month and love it. However... their credit card machine broke for a few days. Which was fine. We went to he ATM and got a lot of cash - cause this place ain't cheap. 

They realized that they could dot it for a few days and now have made the decision to be a cash only business. I don't regularly carry $200 for dinner. This place has taken credit cards forever.  

It is my belief the owner is now just being greedy and not wanting to pay the cc fees. That's lame. We went last night saw the note on the door saying it's all cash permanently and left and went to a great place, Fable - across the street. 

Be warned. Go to the bank and max out your daily withdrawal before you head to Anchor. Good news, is...  they will probably be less busy moving forward.
author: Tim S.

description:
Came back a few times after my review (okay two but that's a few). Each of those times I've decided to go with the cioppino. It's so good. I mean I'm definitely a seafood loving person and with a great garlicky tomato base and the dish brimming with seafood. It's awesome! 

Get there early to get a spot. Or if yourself it's definitely a lot easier to get a seat. 

Pro tip: definitely check out a small cioppino if you're here. It's a big fish and definitely enough to share!
author: Nina Y.

description: The best seafood and Chioppino!! Been coming here for years and can't find better Chioppino and salmon! Of course the best selection of Oysters too!
author: Brandon M.

description: Perfect little seafood restaurant in the Castro district. Best cioppino! The large one was good for 4. Fresh oysters. Clam chowder was perfectly seasoned. Wait staff very friendly and helpful. Groups over 4 may wait a while for a table but worth it. Can't wait to get back there.
author: Mitchell C.

description:
This is small, and delicious Oyster Bar.  If you're heading to San Francisco, you need to stop by the Anchor Oyster Bar.  They will not disappoint. 

Please make sure to sign-in prior to entering.
author: Betsy P.

description:
Really good food. The clam chowder is really tasty. The mimosas are amazing at brunch. You'll most likely have a wait when you first arrive. There are no reservations here. 
The service is pretty quick. It is very small inside. Just a quaint little seafood joint. 
I love to support a great local business. Parking can be an issue. I'd recommend taking Muni and the Castro station is barely two blocks up the street.
author: Chris S.

description: Let me preface this by saying I'd been here years ago and really enjoyed it. But this was a disappointment in a huge way. The restaurant is TINY again TINY. I'm a big guy getting room in an issue but hey when food is great you deal w it. There is ALWAYS a wait, ALWAYS. When food is good you deal w that. This food......awful. I'm not sure how this got so bad or where the old crew is, but I will never be back a shame this has taken such a bad turn. We ordered clam chowder, it had almost nothing in it. Literally all broth. Had garlic bread which came out after the main courses.....was over cooked and burnt on the ends and had no flavor to it. I ordered the cioppino a big serving lots of stuff in it but just no flavor. The broth was bland none of the items inside held any flavor. My gf got the special it was crab pasta. It was a bland mix of noodles and basically white sauce w crab on it. It has way too much sauce on it and it was more like soup. I did have 6 oysters which were decent but nothing you can't get anywhere. I'm not sure what happened here but bad food slow slow slow service tiny tables and super long waits have ruined it. I'm sorry anchor oyster you used to be awesome but you're just one of the worst meals I've had lately.
author: Kraig J.

description: The fresh oysters were perfect, but the **Cioppino**, BEST EVER HAD.  the half order was very large. Seafood was so tender, broth wonderfully seasoned and hot, Garlic bread made you dip into the broth till it was gone.
author: Rick N.

description: Awesome Ciopinno and oysters. The seafood is so fresh and they give you soooo much food. My favorite is the steamed clams. The sauce is amazing.  The service is great too. One of my favorites in SF.
author: Tom K.

description:
Small, casual seafood restaurant with consistently GREAT food! Often with a wait for a seat.

We had clam chowder, combination cocktail with horseradish, crab ceasar salad & seabass with lemon meyer cream sauce. Clam chowder is good...all other dishes were great!!!
Past visit had the crab special. ..ohh my God!!! Best crab ever!....fried with some finger linkin delious seasoning.
Compliments to the chef for small menu....continually delivering delicious food.
Servers also attentive, without hovering. A SF treat.
author: Sharine d.

description: I am not a big seafood person, but was dragged here to eat. It was great, small place so you will be packed in like sardines, but hey its worth it. I highly recommend the clam chowder and garlic bread, my favorites. Oysters were fresh and fantastic. Make sure you pay attention for your name to be called and have your entire party there when your table is ready. Would go again.
author: Andrew M.

description: Steamed clams and Cioppino.... you will walk out with your belly full, fat, and happy. Hands down the best Cioppino I have ever had... so good, it's not even on the menu!
author: A M.

description:
Ordered 40 prawns shelled and raw for pre Christmas sit down dinner.  They accepted the order, while ordering told them not to worry about the cost.  We needed 4 prawns per person - raw and shelled.  The individual accepted the order.

Went and paid today, December 23, prawns are unshelled.  Now our guests are helping us clean shrimp.  Thanks you Oyster Bar for messing up!!!!

The food there is great - they need a manager to understand how to take orders.
author: Paul L.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked forever! I came here with my hubby on Friday around 1:30PM in the afternoon. We only had one table ahead of us. This is a tiny little restaurant in the middle of the Castro area of San Francisco. Parking is hard to find. While my hubby and I waited for a table we saw the parking maids in full force. Check for parking and make sure your meter is full or you will be given a ticket. 

The weather on this day was a down pour. It was nice that they have an outdoor seating area that is has a covered and has 2 padded bench seats, if it weren't for that we probably would of left. As we waited they gave us a sample of clam chowder. It was a nice touch and warmed us up before heading inside for our lunch date. 

The restaurant has a small bar and about 6 tables. I loved that it was so intimate and that you could have a conversation without being to loud or stuffy.  

We tried several items off the menu and all of them were great. We started with the Anchor Special  1/2 order it came with 6 oysters on a half shell, 2 large shrimp and steamed clams.  The oysters were fresh and the shrimp was large. 

Crab cakes appetizer:  It was full of crab and came with a nice sauce

Half order of garlic bread: Nice and warm when it was served it us. 

Cioppino smaller: You must get this! Don't even think about not getting this. Tomato base, crab, shrimp, clams, fish, and so on. It is so tasty and it even comes with a slice or two of garlic bread. Use that to soak the sauce. The dish was so big that I was laughing and we wound up taking home with us. 

Our server was friendly and nice.
author: Kathryn W.

description:
This is my 100th review and I saved it for my true love in SF -- Anchor Oyster Bar.

This place is magical. When I'm feeling down, a bowl of cioppino from Anchor can always cheer me up. It works better than any anti-depressant and makes me forget about the 1.5 hour wait. 

I even looked up the recipe and tried to make it at home, but it's not the same. 

You won, Anchor Oyster Bar. I'll be coming back again and again for the years to come.
author: Joseph L.

description: I ate here weekly in the late 70's and 80's I loved the green lipped mussels.
author: Rod M.

description: I have been coming to this little Gem for many years and this lovely spot never disappoints Lovely food, and quirky venue and service. Highly recommend.
author: Kaleb F.

description:
It is true the food amazing. 
Dishes are fresh made to order "not rushed". 
A small place with great service.
author: Rick C.

description:
So so so delicious

They had an amazing crab sandwich with amazing salad and bleu cheese I dream of

Server was friendly and chefs were passionate, all made to order...

They had a $14 bottle, 174 ML of pierre joet (I think?) 

OYSTERS fat and fresh, salty too
author: Jake C.

description:
Either come early or expect to wait outside for a while. Dont forget to write your name on the waiting board outside.
.
I am a real fan of the Cioppino and at lunch, it may be smaller and it is less expensive than at dinner. If you order it, expect to use your hands the crabmeat is not pre-shelled. It is not a spicy hot but it may be temperature hot and well seasoned. Two pieces of Garlic Bread will accompany this meal.
.
I like to add a dinner salad with their vinaigrette dressing. Beware the little olives do have pits in them.
.
My friend ordered the crab-cake entree, which both of us felt was somewhat bland and seemed to be a bit shy in crab content as well as lacking in flavor. Not to mention with its roasted potatoes the whole meal was really quite dry. 
.
If you like seafood, you may want to give this hole in the wall a shot. To me, it really seems quite good.
author: Caesar A.

description: Awesome Cioppino and garlic bread. I'm still full 2 days later, and I ordered the small!
author: Daniel C.

description:
Looking for a quintessential SF experience? Come to Anchor.

The building is old and when you walk back to the bathroom you can see all the nooks and crannies from its past. Walk-ins only there is often a line but it moves fast, so find a seat on the bench in front because there's a great view of the Castro!

I love taking people from out of town here, I love going on impromptu dates with my gf here, and sometimes I really enjoy coming alone to have an awesome seafood meal by myself at the counter.

Clam chowder is one of the best in the city.

Oysters on point (and they always have a great variety).

Crab cakes on point.

Ciopinno on point.

Garlic bread on point.

Daily specials are always a sweet surprise and I often choose one of them because they are always fresh and interesting.

Pro tip: Get the steamed seafood combo but with clams and black mussels only. The green mussels can turn some people off because of how big they are. If you do that you will have a flawless meal.
author: Taylor S.

description: Always a beautiful time. Mike is always wonderful to suggest wine and food. Patty, what a treat! Thanks for chatting with me tonight. Had a wonderful meal.
author: Tere C.

description: Excellent clam chowder. We had the combo cocktail, which was very fresh and tasty. My husband had Dungeness crab in roasted garlic and I had the cioppini...incredible flavor! The small size can easily feed two.
author: Laura S.

description: Food is great there if you like seafood as they don't have much else. Expect to wait an hour or so for a table, or go close to last seating.
author: Jayde M.

description:
After having a massage, my partner and I decided to have a late lunch. The wait wasn't that bad, as we went shopping and returning to be called next.  

We shared the crab cake appetizer and the large Cioppino.  The crab cakes were very good. Moist and tasty.  The Cioppino was a large soup. My only regret was that it was  a lot of work to get the crab meat out of the shell, though it was already cracked.   I expected this, but being a germ freak, a lot of work.  Lots of crab, mussels, and clams.  The soups was tasty though salty and flavored much with garlic.   A healthy soup that will keep you free from illness.

The seafood in the soup was excellent.  All was good, especially with the garlic bread served to mopped up the soup in the bowl. It was a lot of food that we could not finish it. well the soup that is.  The seafood was all devoured.  

Great service from the staff. Good food.  Great place.
author: Marck N.

description: Love this place! Best seafood in town! Would highly recommend to anyone visiting in town
author: Desiree R.

description:
I had saved up enough OpenTable points to cash out on a $100 voucher and decided to spend it all at Anchor Oyster Bar. Even though they don't take OpenTable reservations, they do in fact take out OpenTable vouchers. So boyfriend and I decided to have a casual lunch here to celebrate our anniversary. 

I did some research before heading here (naturally) and decided that we'd definitely order the cioppino and clam chowder. It was pretty early when we arrived (1130am) so we didn't go too crazy on the raw stuff, which I'll be sure to try next time.

For the two of us we ordered the small cioppino, garlic butter crab (half order) that also comes with a cup of chowder (additional $1 for a bowl instead) and garlic bread. 

We came to the conclusion that we are not cioppino fans. Granted, it was our first time having this dish, and we both were not over the moon about it. It's definitely an acquired taste and could cause some pretty intense heartburn with all that tomato. The chowder however was delicious and so far the best I've had in SF - not at all too salty, with plentiful chunks of clams and potatoes. The garlic bread was delicious and boyfriend was a little upset that we only ordered the half order and demanded that we order a larger size (*fatty alert*). As for the garlic butter crab, this was probably the winner between the two entrees. The sauce was delicious and the crab was not too hard to crack. I mean, we were given all the tools we needed to do so successfully: tiny forks and crab crackers. 

Our bill came out to about $80. OpenTable lets you know to give your server a heads up before using the check so when I whipped out my phone (OT says its okay to have it on mobile or print out) our server was a little thrown off by it and initially wasn't sure if they took it, even after I confirmed the name of the restaurant and address. Anyway, after a quick call to her boss, she said it was allowed and took down the information.

All in all, our experience was good - solid 3.5 - 4 stars. The food was good, service was okay, only thing however is that it may have been a better idea to have dinner here instead of lunch - we just didn't want to wait in a crazy line, so we made sure to visit when they first opened. I'd love to try their raw stuff next time.
author: Kathleene E.

description:
Friends from out of town suggested going here for dinner before taking them to the airport. They said that people were raving about Anchor Oyster Bar online and I can see why. 

We got to the small restaurant about 15 minutes before opening and there were two parties ahead of us already. Not too long after, more people showed up. We were glad we arrived earlier. Put your name on the board so that they know who came first. 

Once they opened, we were promptly seated. There aren't that many tables inside but it gives a homey feeling. Complimentary bread and butter was given after we put in our order.

What we ordered:

Half Order of the Anchor Special: 6 half shell oysters which were fresh and tasty, steamed clams: the broth that came with the clams is amazing, we paired it with the bread, and two chilled prawns that I did not get a chance to try. A  must order. 

Steamed Black Mussels: Mussels were steamed perfectly. Portion was pretty generous as well. The broth has a kick to it but it worked. My friend said it was her favorite of the night and she wouldn't have mind ordering a second. 

Small Cioppino: OMG. This is a must order. Everything about it was good. The broth, the crab, the fish, the clams, the mussels, everything in it is good. It also came with two pieces of garlic bread. If you run out of bread, they'll gladly give you bread for the broth. Omg. I want more.

Take my advice and pay Anchor Oyster Bar a visit. 

We walked here from Dolores Park so I didn't park in the area but I saw plenty of parking walking back so it shouldn't be too bad.
author: Tommy L.

description: Really great seafood. Place is small so there's always a wait, but the wait is worth it. Clams, oysters, Dungeness crab are all on the menu.
author: Jenna G.

description: Service is outstanding and the food is excellent. Feels like an old school family owned neighborhood operation.
author: Isaias A.

description: Nice place. Great seafood, cooked to its full potential. Cod was done perfectly and the full Anchor tray is excellent way to set up the dining experience.
author: Gerard C.

description:
You guys, this place is the bee's knees!! Coming from Oklahoma our seafood options are limited. This place makes me wish I lived closer to the Bay Area. 

We started off with the oysters (duh) and our selections were Connecticut Copps Island (large, delicious), Cape Cod Chatham (medium, salty, yummy), and Tamales Bay Miyagi (small, sweet, my favorite). 

I ordered the small cioppino and my guy ordered the prawns. I won the battle of the entrees. The cioppino was herby, tomatoey, full of seafood deliciousness. The prawns were tasty, too, but it's really hard to get great cioppino in OKC, so again, I win. 

The service was just the right mix of attentive and leave you alone to enjoy your meal. I wish I lived here so we could frequent this place on the reg. A chilly Wednesday night made the wait short but I would have waited outside all night for this yummy food.
author: Adrianne C.

description: This is our go to local place for seafood.  The food is consistently fresh and good whether you get the day special or the standby Cioppino, crab Ceasar salad, or Anchor Special platter.  Service at times could be inconsistent as their throughput is high in a small space.  Wait times could be up to an hour if you visit between 6:30-8:00 p.m. especially Thursday, Friday, and Saturdays.  Wine list is so so.  We really miss the no corkage fee policy as it has recently changed to $15 per bottle.
author: Cookie D.

description:
Great place amazing food! 
When we arrived there the place was packed! We were waiting for about 20min outside, then we ordered clam chowder and one of their specials ! Was delicious! 
Fresh and rich in flavor! 

The waitress was super nice and sweet! 
Not that cheap but can afford once in a while! 

Def recommend and will come back!!!
author: Ovsick H.

description:
This is the perfect example of a real deal mom and pop eatery. 
Everything about this establishment is the way you would like to have it at home neat clean and tidy and phenomenal food. The cioppino is a must have dish. Bring a friend or a large appetite. One of my favorite places in this area.
author: Jimmy B.

description: Mmmm. So Yummy. I had dozen mixed oysters and it was really fresh. The clam chowder was wow. It is delicious as much as boston clam chowder in Boston. I can't wait to try other dishes. We had to wait 30 mins though
author: Eunice P.

description:
Let me first start by letting you know that Castro Street is a little ways out from City Centre on Market Street and Castro but the journey will be rewarded by great seafood.
Anchor Oyster Bar is a small little spot that does not take reservations and is a hidden gem. The service and the vibe are what you expect from a local seafood spot in San Francisco that's been around for 40 years, amazing.
The seafood is fresh, amazing flavour and big portions. We had the Clam Chowder, Wild Prawns and The Crab Cake entree. All the enteree's and the Chowder where as good as advertised. 
The service is very engaging and the server has no problem explaining the menu and letting you know what the specials are and what wine is great with your food.
Take the time to find Anchor, you will not be sorry.
author: U K.

description:
I had never thought that any place would come along to displace a Swan craving on trips to San Francisco, but after a few trips here, I am seriously beyond fan status!  Technically I would give it 4.5 stars and not 5 only because they don't have the greatest variety of oysters when I have gone, but I am happy to round it up to 5!

Small place that provides the chance to quaff fresh oysters in very welcoming surroundings. Service is quietly efficient (quick drink order, fresh bread and butter put out quickly) and just friendly enough to keep you engaged.  If oysters are not enough, make sure to check out the daily specials.  I have had a Welsh fish stew here recently that would make a Welshman go "ffantastig" as they ploughed through the bowl of fragrantly flavorful broth teeming with fish, mussels and perfectly cooked shrimp.  Gauche as it may seem, I always seem to lift up the bowl and slurp down the broth (danger alert : do not attempt this with the Cioppino....I unfortunately found that the slurpage resulted in micro red dots all over my shirt !!) so as to not lose any bit of it.

A recent trip results in the consumption of flounder wrapped around a crab filling which was seasoned enough to keep it interesting, yet with enough care so the sweetness of the crab showed through and was a perfect accompaniment to the flounder.  The accompaniments of mashers tasted like they were treated with a splash of seafood broth and the perfectly cooked broccoli added a pleasant vegetal bite to the dish.

A must stop if you are in the neighborhood and if you are not, its a cheap Uber ride from major metros!!
author: Sunay P.

description: Good cioppino with interesting broth that's less tomatoey compared to others but had more herbal flavors. It tasted better when we added the cocktail sauce from our crab cocktail to it. Love the large fresh shrimp and green lips but the smaller mussels were mealy. The crab pieces were nicely cracked and easy to eat. Portion size is good and can be shared even with a small order.  There's no fillers like pasta in the broth like Sotto Mare. Love the big bowl presentation. It was made with care.
author: Peter T.

description: OMG!! The Wait Took Forever But I know why.. the food here is amazing!!!! Everything was great from the service to the food, even the surrounding community. Great location and easy to find. My wife and I went there last night and We got the Cioppino which had great flavor. We also ordered Garlic Bread, Steamed Mussels, Clam Chowder. Everything was fantastic. Thank you Alex for your wonderful service.
author: Jay S.

description:
There were just a few other people huddled out front at 5:30 on a Friday night.
When our turn came to go inside, we chose seats at the marble topped bar next to the open kitchen.  This isnt a fancy place, not really. It's more of a comfortably stylish place with subway tiles on the wall, and little white hexagonal tiles on the floor. It's warm and friendly; a nice place to be on a chilly evening. 

The thing is, you have to like seafood. Clams, mussles, oysters, crab and fish are the stars here. If you are invited along with seafood-loving friends, but you'd really rather have a steak...sorry. You  could probably cobble together a pretty decent vegetarian meal though, but you'd have to work at it a little. 

This is my kind of menu. Cioppino, chowder, seafood salads, raw oysters, and a couple of fish specials are about it. Add bread and butter ( free and abundant) and something to wash it all down with ( great beer selection on tap and limited but excellent wine choices) and you've got an amazing meal.

I'm jealous of their cooks. I admit it. My kitchen is bigger, but what these cooks turn out from their tiny kitchen with a Baker's Pride mini-oven is impressive and would probably put most of us to shame.  Everything was perfectly cooked. 
We are still talking about our meal a day later... and deciding what we'll get next time.
author: El B.

description:
Like everyone else says: get here early, or be prepared to wait! Or you can do what my friends and I did. We came here around 3 pm and had a second round of lunch. Cheat day, indeed.

I actually just moved here from Boston, and this place really reminds me of a seafood restaurant in the historical North End! I recommend getting the 12 Oysters On The Half Shell, 8 Steamed Clams, 4 Chilled Prawns combo. The clam chowder is also pretty solid and creamy. We kept reading raving reviews on the chowder so we decided to just try a little and ordered a cup. The server was super nice and actually gave us two so it's "easier to share!" haha. 

Initially, we thought service was subpar, especially because we were neglected for the first 10 minutes we weren't completely ignored! Although we were among the first get seated, we were the last to get our order in... Luckily we were given a lot of bread and butter in the meantime.

Overall, great experience! Yummy food in a cute little restaurant. The cioppino also looks amazing. I'll definitely be around to try that!
author: Janet H.

description: Oh! I love this place and the food they the serve so delicious, I'm also a oyster lover, in did, when it serve to me that kind of food the melted in my mouth and I say: Wow! super yummy and super delicious. I miss this place, hopefully I'll be back soon.
author: Team M S.

description:
Came here last Saturday at around 7:00 and waited for an hour for a table for 2,but totally worth it. We had a wine tasting flight in the wine shop right across while waiting which was nice. 

Everything was amazing! We had the half sampler and the "smaller" cioppino and we couldn't finish it (the rest of cioppino made a great pasta left over the next night). 
The oysters were some of the best I've had. As the steamed clams, oh god that sauce! we could've drank it with a straw. It was absolutely delicious! We couldn't stop dipping the bread in it! 
As for the cioppino, it was perfection! The smaller size is good enough for two trust me! Huge plate, generous seafood portions and the sauce is extremely tasty! You never had seafood like this! 
The service was great too! our waiters Micheal, Justin and Nafeteli (sorry If I spelled this wrong) were very friendly, helpful and really made us feel pampered. 

Yes the place is tin and there's always a wait, but it is worth it! Hubby & I already made plans to come here every month or so! It's that good!!
author: Tamara S.

description:
Located in the Castro, Anchor Oyster Bar is very popular restaurant. Honestly, this is the best place to have seafood. It's always fresh and has a nice variety than most seafood places that I've been to. The place is tiny (there are just 4-5 tables and seats around the bar). You can expect to wait because they don't take reservations, and as always in San Francisco, parking can be a bit of an issue.

The chowder is rich and creamy with a good amount of clam. The cioppino is loaded with seafood (clam, shrimps, mussels, crab, cod, oysters) in a delicious herb tomato broth . it came with delicious toasted garlic bread with cheese. They don't serve desserts. 

The staff is very friendly and accommodating. It's no wonder this restaurant has been in business for 34 years!
author: Steve N.

description:
I've been coming to Castro for years, but for the first time, I finally made it to Anchor Oyster Bar!  Major reason is because they are always packed, and they also do not take reservations. You simply sign in on their board outside, put down the number of guest, and wait for your name to be called.

We had planned on ordering their 3 types of fresh oysters, but our waiter suggested we order their famous Cioppino for $50 (huge bowl for two).  Done! It was fantastic and so was the service!

Until then, Cheers! ~ :p
author: Edwin R.

description:
I have loved this place since it opened. And in the past deserved 5 stars. But today the current Monday lunch staff dropped the ball. NOTE TO OWNER -- SOLE WAS FRESH BUT BLAND & UNDERSEASONED! NO CAPERS , NOT EVEN SALT AND PEPPER. IT WAS SERVED LUKEWARM SO HAD TO SEND IT BACK.
It needed garlic, white wine lemon-chili pepper flakes--something! It was fresh but boring.
Still -- the crab w garlic is the best in town.
Also WE MISS THE JAZZ MUSIC! The lame oldies music was sad too.BUT--
They realized things weren't perfect and addressed the issues.
So I'd say if you want the best seafood here avoid Fisherman's Wharf & head straight (no pun intended) to Castro Street, because even on an off day, Anchor is still the best.
author: Scott F.

description:
With the ambiance of an old school candy shop, this Castro seafood restaurant is set up for individuals or small groups (of 3 or 4) without kids who can share their family-sized dishes while munching on oyster crackers that are sprawled all around the restaurant. It's a fun restaurant that's casual in ambiance but has upscale dishes, and has the noise level of starbucks.

Try the Crab Cake entree and clam chowder if you do not want to eat family style. If you do opt for family style, try a special (look above the bar!) or a full size Cioppino with a bottle of wine! (Or you can BYOW and pay a corkage fee.)
author: Regina D.

description:
The best Cioppino in town and it just so happens to be an off menu item. So be sure to ask for it. Also, it is comically huge. Ask for the 1/2 order unless you want to take home leftovers for the rest of the week. 
The service is hit or miss here, I've been here a few times now and it always seems like they're training inexperienced servers and it's always pretty slow. But we're quick to order and know what we like so to us it's not a big deal breaker. 
The specials are always good and they always have a great open face crab sandwich, but we definitely come for the Cioppino. 
It can tend to get busier during the nights so come early or be prepared to put your name on the list and wait.
author: Victoria T.

description: Been in San Francisco for 25 years and still really enjoy this place.  Food is always spot on, the wait can be a little long as they only have five tables, but it's so worth the wait!  I really enjoy coming for lunch on weekdays when it's less crowded and sipping some wine and having a great meal while reading a book or just people watching.  I'm originally from New England, but the clam chowder they have here is by far one of the best.  You can tell they take pride in their food and restaurant, and it shows.
author: Sean M.

description: This is Phenomenal the execution is flawless and it's the reason why it it's a staple for the design of seafood cuisine. Simply outstanding.
author: Joe T.

description:
As always the food is delicious here. We got seated at the bar and only had to wait 5 minutes. Their Bloody Mary is very light, their clam chowder was right on par.
